text:
1. Please take the latest pull... 
2. go to the announce.service,yml there you can change the url... 
3. Since the announcement is tempstored with a time you might forcefully delete it from the db run this drush php `\Drupal::service('keyvalue.expirable')->get('announce')->delete('announcements');`

elements.text: Please take the latest pull...
go to the announce.service,yml there you can change the url...
Since the announcement is tempstored with a time you might forcefully delete it from the db run this drush php
\Drupal::service('keyvalue.expirable')->get('announce')->delete('announcements');

text:
hey <@U06NAEYSF> started with the port of D7 this is the first look. I've made the announcement route as an admin route inorder display it in the toolbar and overlay does the rest. Obviously this look different from  D8 because D7 does not have a dialog model in its core so *do you want to make one* or *will this suffice??*
PS: Apart from the this the backend stuffs are same

text:
I probably suggested this. The first version I saw use some custom JS and not the dialog library. So guess we don’t need to use the Off-canvas(this isn’t *settings tray* exactly) dialog but I do think we should use dialog system.

So I am not sure if you will able to use `\Drupal\Core\Render\MainContent\DialogRenderer` directly or if you will have to extend it like the test `\Drupal\dialog_renderer_test\Render\MainContent\WideModalRenderer` does

elements.text: I probably suggested this. The first version I saw use some custom JS and not the dialog library. So guess we don’t need to use the Off-canvas(this isn’t
settings tray

exactly) dialog but I do think we should use dialog system.

\Drupal\Core\Render\MainContent\DialogRenderer
directly or if you will have to extend it like the test

text: The thing Off-canvas does that you probably don’t want is the resizing of the page

text: <@U7G1P7P6Z> has joined the channel
More discussion happening here: <https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/3206643#comment-14219711>

elements.text: More discussion happening here:

attachments.title: Project messaging channel in core
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation Per the core idea issue: [#2940739] The vast majority of Drupal users do not have accounts on <http://Drupal.org|Drupal.org>, and likely do not regularly follow Drupal project news, or engage with communications channels that promote important updates, news and events, or support for the community and association. The goal of this initiative is to provide a channel for messaging about the Drupal project within the administrative interface of core.
attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Project messaging channel in core
